head.title: Acquisitions Set At WPP and HMS

hedline.hl1: Acquisitions Set At WPP and HMS

abstract.p: WPP Group acquires 49 percent stake in Uniworld Group; HMS Partners is acquiring Workstate, interactive technology agency, and merging it with Studiomotiv, it's interactive design unit; combine unit will be called Motivo (S)

block.p: The WPP Group in London and New York, has acquired a 49 percent stake in the Uniworld Group in New York and Los Angeles, an agency that specializes in advertising and marketing aimed at African-Americans and other ethnic consumers. Terms were not disclosed.

Uniworld, with more than 150 employees and billings estimated at $230 million from clients like AT&T and Microsoft, will work cooperatively with other ethnic marketing agencies that are part of WPP, like Mendoza Dillon and Asociados in Newport Beach, Calif. Byron Lewis, 68, chairman and chief executive at Uniworld, continues in those posts.

Byron Lewis, 68, chairman and chief executive at Uniworld, continues in those posts.

HMS Partners in Columbus, Ohio, is acquiring Workstate in Columbus, an interactive technology agency, and merging it with Studiomotiv, HMS's interactive design unit. Terms were not disclosed. The combined unit, to be called Motivo, will have 31 employees working out of offices in Columbus and New York and billings estimated at $6 million from clients like Hewlett-Packard.
